comments.body: Could use some docs/comments explaining what the stats.custom data structure looks like.
its up to the user, the top level is just the 'var name of the stat', after that it can be anything
Splitting this block (273-286) into it's own method would make it easier for sub classes of the default CallbackModule (like debug, skippy, actionable, dense) to extend this behavior.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +271,275 @@        # print custom stats
        if C.SHOW_CUSTOM_STATS and stats.custom:
            self._display.banner("CUSTOM STATS: ")
            # per host
            #TODO: come up with 'pretty format'
